title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: Three graphs labeled I, II, and III are shown above. One is the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, one is the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, and one is the graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly identifies each of the three graphs?

choices.label: <math alttext="f is I. f prime is II. f double prime is III." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>I</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>II</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>III</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f is II. f prime is III. f double prime is I." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>II</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>III</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>I</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f is III. f prime is I. f double prime is II." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>III</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>I</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>II</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f is III. f prime is II. f double prime is I." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>III</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>II</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>I</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f is III. f prime is II. f double prime is I." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>III</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>II</mtext></mtd><mtd><mtext>I</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
